lines.content: * A Deadline-type Task consisting of its details and deadline in day.
* Constructs a instance of Deadline that consist of its details and deadline in day.
* Return the string representation of Deadline details with day and time, prefixed with [D]
* @return the string representation of Deadline details
* Duke is a simple bot that allows users to keep track of different types of tasks.
private static final ArrayList<Task> list = new ArrayList<>();
* Prints greeting text of the robotFriend.
System.out.println(ROBOT_ICON + ": Hello I am your RobotFriend.\n" + ROBOT_TEXT_SPACE + "How can i help you?");
System.out.println(ROBOT_TEXT_SPACE + "list: view all tasks in the list.");
System.out.println(ROBOT_TEXT_SPACE + "done i: mark task number i as complete and view the task.");
System.out.println(ROBOT_TEXT_SPACE + "delete i: delete the task at the given index i.");
* Echos the user inputted String in a robot way.
* Prints the exiting text in a robot way.
System.out.println(ROBOT_ICON + ": " + "Bye~ Hope to see you soon :)");

* @throws NoTaskDescriptionException if there is no task description, it will result in this error.

* Adds user inputted String to list and prints the user added tasks and the current number of tasks, else
* print error message for the error
System.out.println(ROBOT_ICON + ": " + "You have added this following task to the list:");
* Prints all the tasks in the list.
System.out.println(ROBOT_ICON + ": " + "Your list contains the following task/s:");
* Marks the task as complete and prints out the task, throws error if done command is not properly formatted.
* @param userInput the index of the task in list
System.out.println(ROBOT_ICON + ": " + "You have completed the following task:");
* Delete the task and prints out the task and current number of tasks,
* throws error if done command is not properly formatted.
* @param userInput the index of the task in list
System.out.println(ROBOT_ICON + ": " + "You have removed the following task:");
* A Event-type Task consisting of event details, day and time.
* The day and time in string
* Constructs a instance of Event that consist of event details, day and time
* @param at day and time in string
* Return the string representation of Event details with day and time, prefixed with [E]
* @return the string representation of Event details
* InvalidCommandException is an exception that is thrown when command is not recognized for any type of task.
super(SAD_ROBOT_ICON +": OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means.");
* InvalidIndexException is thrown if done i, where i is the index of task is not a number or taskNumber
* Constructs error message for either delete or done command
* @param commandType is either delete or done command
super(SAD_ROBOT_ICON +": OOPS!!! The task to set as "+ commandType + " does not exists. Please try again!");
* NoDateException is thrown if there is no date/timing provided by either Event or Deadline task.
* Constructs error message for NoDateException depending on the eventType.
* @param taskType it can be either Deadline or Event task type.
super(SAD_ROBOT_ICON +": OOPS!!! The date/timing of a " + taskType + " cannot be empty.");
* NoDateIndicatorException is thrown if there is no /at or /by provided by either Event or Deadline task respectively.
* Constructs error message depending on whether it is Deadline or Event task type.
* @param dateType the dateType can be either Deadline or Event task type.
super(SAD_ROBOT_ICON +": OOPS!!! You are missing " + dateType + " before your timing/date");
* NoTaskDescriptionException is thrown when there is no task description for any task.
* Constructs error message for NoTaskDescriptionException depending on taskType.
super(SAD_ROBOT_ICON +": OOPS!!! The description of a " + taskType + " cannot be empty.");

* Task is an Object that consist of the status of completion and the task details.

* @return A string representation of task details with the prefix of the status of completion of the task.
